intro: Pimelea simplex subsp. simplex, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
